intro: Daucus hispidifolius, commonly known as the hairy-leaved carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
